author: mlemay
title: DAO addressing Digital Divide
description: Las infraestructuras de telecomunicaciones son grandes proyectos que necesitan involucrar a la población en su gobernanza para las iniciativas de redes comunitarias.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is a draft and not much information about the implementation is provided. 
It is not explained, how this DAO will work or operate. Also it remains unclear how the adaption of this idea will happen.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer doesn't provide any information about the implementation. The idea is not clear described. A plan is missing. Also we don't find evidence about the proposers ability to turn this idea into a successful business.
f6_assessments.q2: No info has been provided to show how this project will solve the problems it wants to solve. There is no way to track the progress or success of this project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal provides very little detail that would enable me to evaluate its potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem.  There are just a couple of paragraphs more or less cut and pasted from the proposer's company's website, and I cannot see any connection to Cardano at all.  Even if I want to give the benefit of the doubt that the project would be in context of the Cardano ecosystem, I see very little detail about what project is actually proposed, making it difficult to assess potential impact.  I do think there is potentially a project of interest that could positively impact the Cardano ecosystem, so I encourage the proposer to resubmit for the next fund, and to provide more detailed explanation of the problem, proposed solution, along with appropriate milestones, deliverables, KPIs, and Budget breakdown.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no information about milestones or deliverables, and no Budget breakdown.  Therefore, I cannot assess feasibility and unfortunately must give a low assessment in that regard.
f6_assessments.q2: Again, because there is no discussion of milestones or deliverables, it is not possibly to assess accountability from this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think I am competent to assess this proposal as I have been active in project Catalyst since fund 4 and I have experience analyzing business requirements from over 5 years of delivering software solutions for small business and corporations as well.
I find the problem statement too general, in the sense that I don't understand why a Telecom company would need to involve the population in their own governance "for community network initiatives". Unfortunately I did not find any explanation for this in the problem or the detailed plan either. It is not good when a problem statement, instead of telling you something that you can understand easily, leaves you with unanswered questions. In this case: what population should they involve? What community network initiatives are you referring to? What Telecom companies are you thinking about?
The solution as well is very vague. How would this DAO work? Who would join it and how? What is the role of the smart contracts here? In the detailed plan it is simply stated in a general manner that recent world events have accelerated radical digital transformations and thus investing in partnerships with communities is what is needed to make telecom infrastructure sustainable. I would have expected to hear a practical use case here and the way in which this project will be built. Right now, it sounds more like a general presentation of what the "Digital Ubiquity Capital" company that is mentioned here does.
At the moment, I strongly disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, as I do not understand what it intends to do. Details are needed on what this DAO is and how it would bring value to Cardano, what the KPI's for this project are and how the work will be done.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has only mentioned that "the team has been developing on functional programming and is now part of a group structuring capital for large infrastructure projects". In order for the proposal to prove to voters that the team behind it can deliver, it would need details on the team members and their experience, with credentials provided, or at the very least, if a company is behind this project, a showcase of what it has delivered for other clients. The phrase "developing on functional programming" does not help me understand what relevant skills the people here have.
I strongly disagree that this proposal can be implemented successfully, due to the lack of information on the team who would work on this, no details on how the budget would be used, no risk analysis and no plan outlining the technical approach and the usage of resources concretely. This is all crucial information that the proposal needs in order for us to understand how it would try to accomplish what it wants to accomplish.
f6_assessments.q2: I strongly disagree that the information here is sufficient for this proposal to be auditable, or clear to understand. It needs to clarify what it wants to do and it needs a roadmap of how it will do it, as well as KPI's to help track its progress.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal try to address the main objectives of the challenge, by proposing a DAO with smart contracts that has the possibility to influence the direction of large telecommunication infrastructure projects. In my opinion the team's idea is difficult to implement unless the team get government and telecom provider onboard. Unfortunately the team only provides details on the background problem but not on the proposed solution.
f6_assessments.q1: The team does mention relevant experience in the proposal but does not provide complete details about the project. The incomplete proposal makes it hard for community to ensure the continuation and success of this project. The team requested a budget without detail on how the money will be spend or allocated. There is no roadmap, budget breakdown, or timeline for the execution of this project in the proposal. My suggestion for the team is to complete the proposal with more information and details.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no clear success metrics or KPI in the proposal. The team does not provide deliverables, roadmap, or detailed plan on how to execute the project and there is no budget breakdown in the proposal. Team does not mention where they will publish the progress of project execution making it impossible to trace, monitor, or audit the project. My suggestion for the team is to update the proposal with more information and details including deliverables, goals, KPI, roadmap, detailed execution plan, and budget breakdown.

f6_assessments.q0: This is an idea that could be great, however, the proposal has no concrete plan on how to achieve it. How to create a DAO with smart contracts that has the possibility to influence the direction (market, impact, etc.) of large connectivity projects. We need a plan for this
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately no plan has been provided. Please provide a plan on what content you would deliver , where and how you would do it. This should be combined with a detailed budget with timelines and milestones.
f6_assessments.q2: As no actual plan has been provided it is not possible to audit progress or success of this proposal. Please include timelines and deliverable against which progress could be measured and produce some metrics for success.

f6_assessments.q0: DAO addressing Digital Divide is an area that requires seriousness and in-depth detail on technical solutions. But in the entirety of the content presented I do not see the specific identity or experience of the proponent. The proposal has not yet set out goals, KPIs, and implementation strategies. Therefore, I do not agree with this immoral proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: I really doubt that with a proposal with such a sketchy presentation, the implementation in practice is not high. Presenters need technical solutions that go into depth, so that the community can understand what you are going to do to contribute. Second, you need detailed KPIs and a clear plan for each implementation item. In particular, you need to disclose the identity of the participants in your team.
f6_assessments.q2: A DAO project once completed is easy for the community to check out. But since it is suggested that the channel or place where the workgroup KPI can be seen is not clear, it is not feasible to double-check the work progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about creating a DAO with smart contracts that has the possibility to influence the direction (market, impact, etc.) of large connectivity projects. It seems that this proposal is incomplete. The problem is understandable and explained in detail plan, argument of why why investing in partnership with communities for digital infrastructures project  is required.
Conceptually, I think it (this idea) has a certain fit for the challenge. However, the solution is not completed [no goals/target, no road map with metrics, no budget breakdown, and no risk analysis [this ambitous idea must face potential risk, I suppose]. Based on the given information, I  disagree with this proposal's impact, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1:
It's difficult to evaluate an incomplete proposal without detailed plan. In terms of idea, through the team's website [https://www.digitalubiquitycapital.com/about/], I can see suitbale experences for this kind of idea. For more evaluation of feasibility, detailed plan is required. Therefore, there is ground for agreeing on the feasibility of this proposal.
Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasible, and would give it with a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: Undoubtedly, for an incomplete proposal with very limited information like this, auditability/transparency can't be guaranteed. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.

solution: Crear una DAO con contratos inteligentes que tenga la posibilidad de influir en la dirección (mercado, impacto, etc.) de grandes proyectos de conectividad.
experience: El equipo se ha desarrollado en la programación funcional y ahora forma parte de un grupo que estructura el capital para grandes proyectos de infraestructura.
